alert.note: Alert for Dundy (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 23 at 2:39PM CST until December 24 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM MST /MIDNIGHT CST/ THIS EVENING TO 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow and low visibility. Total snow accumulations between one and three inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Visibility between a quarter of a mile and a mile. * WHERE...In Kansas, Cheyenne and Sherman Counties. In Nebraska, Dundy County. * WHEN...From 11 PM MST /midnight CST/ this evening to 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blizzard conditions are possible at times with strong wind gusts and heavy snow. Expect visibility to drop to near a quarter of a mile at times. There is the chance for bands of heavy snow. If these bands form, they could produce an additional three to eight inches of snowfall for small patches of the advisory area. Widespread heavy snow is not expected at this time.
info.instruction: Be sure to check the forecast and road conditions before traveling. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Conditions could change rapidly. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
